data.title: Two Thumbs Up!
data.text: My wife and I ate here last night and it was awesome. We were wanting some good pizza and I heard earlier that day some people talking about a great pizza place downtown so We thought we would try it out. I am really glad we did. We got the thin crust pizza . It is a nice family friendly place to eat. The service was wonderful and very attentive . They have a lot more than pizza on there menu and they have a bar with high top tables along the outside edge in a separate room off the main dining area. I could not believe that the place was packed for a Thursday night,but after eating there, I see why now. If you are looking for some great pizza in a nice atmosphere then you have to eat here. We will definitely eat here again the next time I am in Springfield.

data.title: Pizza night in
data.text: Ordered carryout on a Wednesday night, the pizza was very good, a little pricey but the large was definitely a large. I also ordered a half order of fries and the guy who took my order asked if I wanted the cheese sauce, so glad he did, the cheese sauce was delicious and would dip almost anything in it

data.title: Yum
data.text: Great food, and Friendly service, Of you are just having appetizers, which I doubt you would lol have the MUSHROOMS Heavenly

data.title: Very Good - A little pricy
data.text: The (EBA) Everything but anchovies pizza is very good - chef salad was wonderful and cheese garlic bread also very good.  Delivery was pretty fast and food was hot.

data.title: Delivery ontime, pizza great!!
data.text: I highly recommend Gabatoni's Everything But Anchovies pizza.  Had it delivered and it was great.  I will get another when in town.  Thanks!

data.title: Dinner
data.text: Loved the patriotic decor and the pizza and salad delicious. The tiramisu was great but the prize was the fabulous onion rings. Plan your meal to include those

data.title: Great thin-crust pizza
data.text: This is the best thin crust pizza in Springfield.  The restaurant accommodations are fairly simple but the food is great. I drive through and pick up pizza for my family often.  I can't wait to get home so I often eat the edges off the pizza while I am in the car--then blame it on the restaurant staff when my grandsons ask why the pizza is missing!

data.title: Good pizza and good service
data.text: We went on a Thursday night and it was packed with people.  Nice place, definitely not a chain and had a family restaurant atmosphere.  The pizza was very good and the service was excellent.

data.title: Good quality local pizza, salads, drinks.
data.text: Varied menu. Good pizza, salads. Nice, casual, and affordable Italian fare. Interior a bit dated, however, food and service more than make up for ambience.

data.title: Linda
data.text: Had pizza and salad..excellent! Convenient location. Staff very friendly and helpful. Interesting atmosphere.

data.title: Truly hometown pizza - no chain here!
data.text:
The building obviously has grown over the past 40 years, and if you glance into the kitchen you can see that it has grown around the massive pizza oven!

Truly the best pizza around - the crust is paper thin, cooked perfectly brown at the edges, and the small squares are a delight to much on! We had the Meat Lovers - marvelous array of meats cooked to perfection. We also had the a combo salad and also can verify that this is a TRUE pizza parlor - anchovies were proudly displayed on the ingredient list and were a fantastic addition to the salad!

We were anticipating the crowd so we arrived a little after five; within 30 minutes, the place was packed and reservations were required! It's obvious that Gabatoni's has a well deserved reputation!

data.title: Best pizza in Springfield
data.text: I have been eating their pizza for most of my life.Great atmosphere, friendly and efficient staff,fast service. The menu has a lot of variety but I have only had their pizza. It is a bar as well, all ages are welcome. It stays busy especially on the weekends and now that our state fair is going on it will be busy as well. The prices are reasonable. As busy as it gets you can still have conversation with your group. You can also get your food to go.

data.title: Great date night
data.text: Yummy pizza!! It's a great local place with old world ambiance and terrific  food and friendly and outgoing staff. Do not miss the fried mushrooms. Come hungry.

data.title: Great Pizza!
data.text: I am from Texas and am so tired of all the chain pizza restaurants.  While visiting Springfield I looked for a "family" pizza restaurant and found Gabatoni's.  The reviews seemed right and that's where I went.  I was traveling with three little dogs and went inside to place a to-go order.  The pizza was the best I had had in many many years...probably since I last visited Chicago.  There was also a young man who worked there who was awesome.  I apologize to him but I have forgotten his name.  Not only was the pizza great, so was he.  I would encourage anyone who wants a really good pizza to stop in Gabatoni's...you won't be sorry.

data.title: Best pizza in Springfield
data.text: My family has been eating here for over 40 years.  Their pizza is thin crust and absolutely delicious.  The wait staff is very friendly and quick to refill your drinks.  Great place for couples, families or large groups.

data.title: Back for our first dine in experience
data.text: Had ordered take out pizza that was amazing so decided to go dine in.  Wonderful old school neighborhood restaurant.  Quaint and cozy, not pretentious at all, very good  wait staff.  Get the big plate of fried mushrooms...dang.

data.title: The Best Pizza in Springfield
data.text: This pizza place has been my family's favorite for as long as I can remember. We eat it every time we get together, and it hasn't changed. The last time I went I still couldn't believe how amazing the pizza was. Whether you like thin or thick crust, you'll be happy with this place. It's worth breaking away from chain pizza places.

data.title: Great Experience
data.text: This place is great! Known for the best pizza around, and they lived up to it! The Barbecue Chicken pizza was fantastic as well as the mozzarella sticks, with their homemade marinara meat sauce. A bit on the pricey side, but well worth the price! A must go if you are a pizza lover!

data.title: Longevity must mean something
data.text: This place has been here since probably Lincoln's second term.  The staff have always been friendly but a bit spacey.  The food is ample and pretty good, but not outstanding.  Prices are extremely reasonable.

data.title: Best pizza I ever had
data.text:
I asked a local who had the best pizza in town that was also kid friendly. The answer was Gabatoni's.  So we stopped in and we were extremely satisfied with every aspect of our experience.
We ordered the fried cheese ravioli with a Alfredo sauce to dip. The appetizer was big enough for 2 adults and a child to enjoy and scrumptious.  
We each ordered a pizza and it was the best I have ever had. The small was just the right size to fill me up with a few leftovers for a midnight snack later.
  Our waitress, Jessica, was friendly and attentive. We enjoyed talking to her. 
  Definitely give this place a try. We will probably stop here again on our return trip home. It's a close enough place to eat and take a break from the tourist attractions. 
But you will probably need to ask a local how to get there :)
